$general_hint_13=割れたガラスを踏んだり、 警報缶に触れてはいけない。- これらは君の居場所を明らかにし、敵の注意を引く可能性がある。
$general_hint_14=オートショットガンを使う際は、近接攻撃も可能な事を忘れるな。
$general_hint_15=加圧式武器のタンクの空気圧は圧力計で確認できる。
$general_hint_16=危険地帯を通過した後はガスマスクを外すのを忘れるな。戦闘で壊れるのを少しでも避ける為だ。
$general_hint_17=手首のLEDライトセンサーは、 君がどれだけの光に照らされているかを示す。影に留まるように努めろ。<time>を押すとより見やすくなる。

2033_intro_notags=I was born in Moscow, but I remember nothing of that time. I was just an infant when the old world was destroyed in the flames of nuclear fire, I, along with 40 thousand others, were saved by retreating to the Metro stations deep under the city. Now, 20 years had passed, and going up into the embrace of an endless winter was left to a few brave souls. The Metro was our home, and our fortress against the nightmarish mutants who roamed the tunnels. Still, we never gave up hope that we would return to the surface. But one day, a new threat appeared... and we found ourselves in a war to determine the very existence of our species...
2033_outro_bad_notags=A wise man once said, "He who leads a war for the love of his fellow men,  will defeat his enemies". I led my war protecting my family and friends, protecting my home – the Metro. We had won. But, to this day, I wonder: When we burned the Dark Ones from the face of the Earth, was something lost as well...?
2033_outro_good_notags=H.G. Wells once wrote, "If we don't end wars, wars will end us". And somehow, I stopped my war. At the time, I couldn't say what had made me spare the Dark Ones. But, I came to realize that the strange visions that haunted my journey were their attempts to reach out to us. I don't know if I was the first to communicate with them, but I will not be the last. They are among us now...and the future – our future – stretches before us like an endless Metro tunnel.

Copy of $weapons_gold_caliber=3番目のスロットに入る自動小銃には軍用弾が装填できる。<wpn_reload>を押して弾薬の種類を選択する。軍用弾はメトロの手製弾薬より大きなダメージを与えることができる。だが気をつけろ、希少な軍用弾を撃つということは、金を飛ばすようなものだからだ。
Copy of $weapons_gold_caliber_pickup=軍用弾を手に入れた。大戦前の弾薬は高性能なため、高い価値を持っている。軍用弾はショップで武器やアイテムを購入するための通貨としても利用できる。他の弾薬と取り替えてもらうことも可能だ。軍用弾は汚れておらず、薬莢も輝いているので貴重なものだとすぐわかる。

intro=<time=1> 全ての始まりについて聞かれたとき時<time=2230> <time=2415> 僕は、みんなで植物園に行った時だったと答える <time=6682> <time=7129> 「みんな」とは、僕と2人の友達のことだ<time=10566> <time=11831> 捨てられた駅へ行こうと言い出したのは誰だった？<time=14764> <time=15401> 誘ってきたのは誰だった？<time=17450> <time=17961> 僕はいつも、覚えてないと答える <time=20470> <time=22477> 僕は嘘つきだ<time=23888> <time=24492> 自分を守るためだ。真実を知る方法はもう無い <time=29142> <time=30250> 友達のヴィタリとユージーンはもう死んでる<time=33014> <time=34523> 巨大なエアロックのドアが、きしむ音と共に開いた<time=39702> <time=40752> 僕達にとっては地獄への道が、悪魔たちにとってはメトロへの道が開かれた<time=46830> <time=47712> だが実際は、あの日に始まっていた<time=50482> <time=50933> 母さんが植物園へ行こうと言った日の事だ... <time=55062> <time=55485> そこへはメトロで行ったんだ！<time=57098> <time=57650> 地上へ出るのに短いエスカレーターに乗ったのを覚えてる <time=61430> <time=61841> 僕は大きなガラスのパビリオンや、道に広がる草木を見て興奮した <time=67838> <time=68436> 無限の空に広がる小さな雲も見た。涼しいそよ風が気持ちよかった<time=76970> <time=77735> 母さんがアイスクリームを買ってくれた… <time=80046> <time=80359> あれを食べたのはそれが最後だった<time=83152> <time=84010> その日、人類は罰を受けた <time=86838> <time=87139> 善人も悪人も、その行いに応じて裁かれた<time=92068> <time=94819> 僕たちは神の目から逃れるためメトロに避難した<time=97084> <time=97995> そして、神の怒りから生き延びた <time=100032> <time=100404> だが、神は僕たちを炙り出す価値もないと判断したようだった<time=104856> <time=105704> その後どこかへ行ったのか、死んだのかもしれない<time=109094> <time=109819> 僕たちはこの荒れた地にとり残されー <time=112948> <time=112966> それでも、この地で生き続けていく... <time=115160> <time=115578> 続くかぎり...<time=116954> <time=117598> どうでもいいことはたくさん覚えている...<time=121464> <time=122312> だが、一番大切なことが思い出せない <time=124954> <time=126578> 母さんの顔だ<time=127902> <time=128564> 母さんは戦争が始まってすぐに亡くなった... <time=131936> <time=132227> あの植物園でのひと時が　唯一の思い出だ<time=136036> <time=136882> あの顔を思い出したい！<time=139448> <time=140510>  僕を見つめる時の顔<time=141770> <time=142089> 「心配ないわ」とささやく時の顔<time=145276> <time=146495> 思い出せるなら、この魂だって差し出す <time=148782> <time=150268> いつなんどきでも、そうするさ <time=152794> <time=159609> そして、そうしたんだ<time=160562> <time=160561>  <time=161640> 
intro_dark=<time=1516> やがて、ダークワンが現れた… <time=3542> <time=4337> 植物園の方からだ。<time=5922> <time=7605> ダークワン…<time=8592> <time=9050> 大男を頭一つ越すほどの大きさを持つ、 <time=12742> <time=13753> 悪夢のような生物… <time=15332> <time=16371> 人の憎悪を具現化したような恐ろしさ… <time=18734> <time=20022> 我々を滅ぼすために産まれた怪物だ。<time=22152> <time=23778> 文字通り、恐ろしく強く異常な邪悪さを持つ。<time=27674> <time=28462> 武装した男を素手で引き裂くことができるという。 <time=31534> <time=35626> すべて嘘だ。<time=37100> <time=40966> 真実はもっと恐ろしい。<time=43184> <time=43200>  <time=43400> 
intro_notags=全てがどうやって始まったのか聞かれるとき、僕は決まって、みんなで植物園に行ったときに始まったと言うんだ。みんな―本当のところを意味するのは僕と2人の友だちのことだ。いったい誰が廃れた駅に行こうと考えたんだろう、誰が他の人を説得したんだろう。いつも僕が言うのは覚えていないということだけ。それはいつだって嘘だ。真実を確かめるものは誰もいない、暴かれることのない嘘だ。僕の友だち両方とも今となっては死んでいる。巨大なエアロックのドアはきしむ音と共に開き、デーモンたちがメトロへ至る地獄への道となった。しかしその日は母さんが植物園へ散歩に行こうと言った日でもあったんだ…メトロを経由して！僕が覚えているのは、短いエスカレーターを使って地表に出て、ガラスのパビリオンや緑で埋まったストリートをみて興奮したこと、小さな雲が柔らかに、果てしない空を横切っていく、爽やかな風が頬をなでたこと。母さんがアイスクリームを買ってくれて…それを食べたのはあれが最後だった。その日、人類に審判が下った。高潔な者も罪深い者も、その行為に報いを受けたと言った。そして僕たちはメトロで神の目から隠れ、怒りから救われた。神は僕たちを地下までも洗い流す価値はないと思ったようだ。それで神は仕事を果たしたか、あるいは死んだ。荒廃した地球で―どこにもいかず―見捨てられたままとどまっている。役に立たない色んなことを覚えている。それなのに一番大切なもの、母さんの顔を覚えていない。戦争が始まってすぐに母さんは亡くなってしまった。僕はその頃まだ小さな子供だった。残っているのは、植物園の日のことだけだ…どうやったら母さんの顔を思い出せるんだ！僕を見つめ、恐れることなんて何もないとささやいた、母さんを思い出せるなら魂を売ったっていい、そう思わない日はない、いつだって、どんなときも。

l00_intro_0_narration_NAME=プロローグ
l00_intro_1=スパルタ
l00_intro_1_diary_0=I must do what Hunter demanded of me, what Miller ordered me, what Anna expects of me. I must prove to them all that I deserve to be one of them. To be one of the Order's fighters, to dedicate my life to the protection of humanity. The protection of the Metro. This mission is tailor-made for me. I am the only one impervious to the influence of the Dark Ones. Perhaps, I was born to rid humanity of them once and for all. And now I am one step from fulfilling that task. So why am I so uneasy?
l00_intro_1_diary_1=But maybe, the Dark Ones aren't the reason for this... It's troubled times we live in. The whole Order is humming like a beehive. Once created to safeguard the Metro against any dangers, it inadvertently introduced a new danger on its own... When we entered the tunnels of the D6 secret military installation and found the vast sealed storage facilities we thought we'd saved humanity! With the stockpiles of food and medical supplies stored here, with the functional reactor, we all could survive indefinitely. And live to see the day when the radiation on the surface goes down and we are able to go back there and make Earth our home once more.
l00_intro_1_narration_DSC=ちょうど一年前、僕はテレビ塔の上から植物園にミサイルが降り注ぐのを見ていた。生き物は灰と化し、鉄とガラスが溶けていくのを目にした。あの炎の中を生き延びられる者などいるはずがない。だが、カーンがそこでダークワンを見たと言った。僕の任務は奴を見つけて始末すること。こんどこそケリをつけなければ。
l00_intro_1_narration_DSC_short=ちょうど一年前、僕はテレビ塔の上から植物園にミサイルが降り注ぐのを見ていた。生き物は灰と化し、鉄とガラスが溶けていくのを目にした。あの炎の中を生き延びられるものなどいるはずがない。だが、カーンがそこでダークワンを見たと言った。僕の任務は奴を見つけて始末すること。こんどこそケリをつけなければ。
l00_intro_1_narration_NAME=過去へと続く列車
l00_intro_1_narration_NAME_in_game=第1章.過去へと続く列車
l00_intro_2=灰
l00_intro_diary_0=There’s nobody among the Order’s fighters who’d ever lived at the Exhibition. Why would they risk their lives to save us, total strangers to them. What for? Perhaps they, just as I do, believe that the Dark Ones are a threat not for just our God-forgotten backwater station, but for the Metro as a whole? That, I don’t know. But one thing I know for sure: I can’t watch these people and not feel admiration. They couldn’t care less which station we hailed from, which god and which politics we believed, the one thing they actually cared about was that we were human beings and we were in danger. When joining the Order, one vows  to protect the Metro, the last refuge of human race, to the end. Some of them believe they can prevail; a lot more think we’re all doomed regardless – but they don’t even think of laying down their arms and giving up the struggle. Such were Hunter’s comrades. And it would be the highest honor for me to become one of them. 
l01_hunter_diary_0=Day after day our patrols go out to the northern tunnels, and day after day they return bearing casualties. Murdered brutally, inexplicably so. Even more casualties come back alive, but insane. And yet it’s only by sending our friends, neighbors and relatives out there that we can keep the Dark Ones at a distance. When we run out of manpower to stop their attacks far enough, when they arrive at the station itself, we’ll be done for. I hear people talking secretly at the station that it’s just us prolonging the agony, that there’s no hope for salvation. But Sukhoi, my stepfather and the head of the station, still hopes for a miracle. He insists that an old friend of his, Hunter, can save us. Hunter is a member of the Spartan Order, a battle brotherhood sworn to protecting the Metro from any and all dangers. There is nothing capable of instilling fear into the hearts of those men… At least there was nothing – until the Dark Ones arrived.
l01_jail=パヴェル
l01_jail_diary_0=The dead Botanical Gardens were always a deadly, deserted place. Stalkers used to avoid it even before the Dark Ones built their... hive... or city there. I was the only person in the world who'd eagerly go there. But this time some Reich stalkers were there, too. These race purists almost never venture out of their stations in the center of the city! What were they looking for in the smoldering remains of the Gardens? And why didn't Anna help me? Miller's daughter would never abandon a comrade! What if they captured her, too? She's a rude tomboy and seems to hate me to boot, since I'm nothing like Hunter, but... I'm worried about her.
l01_jail_narration_DSC=植物園の跡地で見つけた怪物はダークワンのようだった…　そいつは僕の精神に入り込み、一番奥にあるものを引きずり出した…　だが、あれはまだ子供だった。そして明らかに…　ヤツは僕のことを知っていた。僕を恐れていた。ヤツにしばらくの間気絶させられた…　その間に捕らえられてしまった…
l01_jail_narration_DSC_short=植物園の跡地で見つけた怪物はダークワンのようだった…　そいつは僕の精神に入り込み、一番奥にあるものを引きずり出した…　だが、あれはまだ子供だった。そして明らかに…　ヤツは僕のことを知っていた。僕を恐れていた。ヤツにしばらくの間気絶させられた…　その間に捕らえられてしまった…
l01_jail_narration_NAME=敵の敵
l02_escape=帝国
l02_escape_diary_0=The Dark One was here, at the Reich concentration camp, but he's long gone. Well... That means I'll just have to follow him. The mission assigned to me by Miller still stands. I will find the Dark One... and then I'll decide what to do next. If that Nazi was telling the truth and he really did sell the creature to Hansa traders, now the Dark One can be just about anywhere. Hansa occupies the ring line of the Moscow Metro and is a union of trading stations. They still have regular train service with cargo and passenger caravans... In one day the Dark One may surface on the other side of the Metro. I might have lost him now. I don't know how the Dark One avoided torture and execution. The Nazis regularly hang people for having a "wrongly" shaped skull, so a creature like the Dark One should seem an embodiment of evil and corruption to them.
l02_escape_narration_DSC=この収容所からの脱出劇にタイトルを付けるとしたら"敵の敵は我が友"といったところか。その友の名はパヴェル。彼はナチスに一掃された偵察隊の隊長だった。共産主義者は嫌いだが、パヴェルは真の英雄だ。
l02_escape_narration_DSC_short=この収容所からの脱出劇にタイトルを付けるとしたら"敵の敵は我が友"といったところか。その友の名はパヴェル。彼はナチスに一掃された偵察隊の隊長だった。共産主義者は嫌いだが、パヴェルは真の英雄だ。
l02_escape_narration_NAME=帝国
l02_exhibition_diary_0=The task of defending our home station from the Dark Ones, enemies horrifying, mysterious and unbeatable, is becoming the sole focus of all of our efforts. We’ve all but forgotten our old enemies – the nosalises and the watchmen, and if not for Hunter these beasts would have been unleashed on our hospital. I cringe to think of the carnage that would ensue, should Hunter have arrived a mere hour too late…
l02_exhibition_diary_1=But Hunter arrived at the Exhibition just on time. I like to think that was not just blind luck, that it was Fate at work. And that it was the same Fate that made Hunter choose me to travel to polis with his report on the Dark Ones. It seems that I’ve dreamt of visiting Polis, the great, legendary center of the Metro, the center of our civilization, my whole life. But a chance to actually make that dream come true just had come by now of all times, when my home station desperately heeds every fighter it can field. Do I have the right to abandon my adopted father, my friends in an hour of danger? Where is my place – next to them on the barricades or at the far stations where Hunter sends me? I don't know for sure, but I still set out on a journey. I'd like to believe that I am summoned by fate.
l03_camp=l03_camp
l03_camp_1=別離
l03_camp_1_coop=Camp (COOP)
l03_camp_2=収容所
l03_camp_2_diary_0=基本的に、メトロでは恒久和平が実現したことはない。統治機構はほんの数年で崩壊した。今までの世界がもうないと明らかになってから、それは自ら解体されたのである。政府はウラル山脈のどこかで逃げ延びているという噂もあったがーーただの噂だ。ロシアは二度と瓦礫の中から再建されることはなかった。地下鉄駅は自治州となり、昨日の隣人は恐ろしい敵へと変わった。メトロで生き延びることは、闘争だーー食料、空気、1インチ四方の居住空間を巡って。審判の日を地下鉄で生き延びた20万人のうち、今でも生き延びているのはその4分の1強といったところだ。ハンザ、レッドライン、ライヒは戦うことをためらわず、強大な勢力へと成長した。だが、メトロの血塗られた歴史の中では、戦いは一度のみならず起こったことだ。僕たちの小さな地下世界は新しい、最後の世界大戦に直面しているのだろうか？
l03_camp_2_narration_DSC=パヴェルはもう少しで絞首刑にかけられてしまう。彼が僕を逃がしてくれなかったら、僕の身に何が起きていたと思う？赤、青、黄色ーーそこに何の違いがある？彼は僕のために命を賭けてくれた。それ以上のことは、メトロでは望めない。僕は彼を見捨てることはできない・・・。
l03_camp_2_narration_DSC_short=パヴェルはもう少しで絞首刑にかけられてしまう。彼が僕を逃がしてくれなかったら、僕の身に何が起きていたと思う？赤、青、黄色ーーそこに何の違いがある？彼は僕のために命を賭けてくれた。それ以上のことは、メトロでは望めない。僕は彼を見捨てることはできない・・・。
l03_camp_2_narration_NAME=友
l03_camp_diary_0=総統の怒り狂ったとりとめのない話を聞いているうちに、全てのパズルのピースがはまっていくような感覚を覚えた・・・パトロール隊が襲われたこと、僕がポリスの代表として捕らわれたこと・・・D6の存在はもう秘密じゃない。メトロ中を巻き込む大戦がすぐそこに迫っている・・・。

l03_camp_diary_1=Having a guide like Pavel sure puts my mind at ease. It seems he'd been here before. And Reich's peculiarities don't surprise him. I wish I knew what kind of mission he was on... But I just can't find the right moment to talk. But Pavel seemed to know that Reich was poised for war beforehand, while to me this was a revelation. The tales of the stores we found in D6 are already circulating through the Metro. The Order was not going to hog the find, but we're running out of time to explain this. Reich is already almost at the Order's throat trying to take the Vault... So what's going to happen when the Red Line and Hansa find out about the bunker? So that's the war Miller was talking about...
l03_camp_narration_DSC=僕たちは不可能を可能にした。次は、ダークワンを見失ったことをオーダーに伝えなければならない。それは任務が失敗に終わったと認めるということだ。だが、ヤツがメトロ内にいるなら僕一人で見つけることはできないだろう。最寄りの駅にたどり着き、オーダーの本部、ポリスへ向かわなければ。パヴェルが道を示してくれる。

l04_catacombs=松明
l04_catacombs_diary_0=The tunnels and stations of the Metro are but a part of the subterranean construction projects carried out in the long ages of Moscow's history. The Dukes would build secret passages and hideouts, the tsars would construct catacombs and reliquaries – and even then, centuries ago they would routinely stumble upon even older passages created in times immemorial, and perhaps even not by humans. Caves, underground riverbeds... Nobody really knows what's there around the Metro stations, above them or below them. There are no maps, for the cartographers never come back from their expeditions... And those strange, nightmarish creatures inhabiting the catacombs – were they really born of radiation? Could they have always lived there? Perhaps they would just avoid men before, but now, feeling that our end is near, that we're no longer the masters of the Earth, they got braver and now approach us closer and closer to finally jump us and feed on us while we're still warm?
l04_catacombs_diary_1=Pavel was captured in the vicinity of the Gardens, just like me. I wonder, what could he have been doing out there? What the hell were all of them doing out there? I think I'll hit him with that question – later. Right now we just need to stay alive and break out of the Reich borders. 
l04_catacombs_narration_DSC=僕はパヴェルを絞首刑から救い出し、彼は、できるだけポリスの近くへ連れて行くと僕に言った。その後、起こったことを全てオーダーに報告しなければ。伝説的なシアター駅の道は、この放棄された場所へと続いていた。僕はここのことを知らない。この新しい友が居なければ完全に迷子になっていただろう。彼が道を知っていればいいが

l04_catacombs_narration_NAME=暗闇をぬけて
l04_outdoor_diary_0=Since the day we ended up in the Metro, I have gone up to the surface only a few times. The background radiation is too high there, so frequent ventures out translate into grave illnesses to those brave enough to attempt them. One has to stay constantly alert on the surface. The pollution tends to be uneven; there are hotspots which could dole out a lethal dose of radiation in a matter of minutes, while some places could actually be habitable if not for the monsters and unbearable gloominess. The eye can't discern between a safe place and a hotspot; you have to use a Geiger counter. You can't go out to the surface without a gas mask, either. We used to own the Earth. Today, although I still remember that summer day in the Gardens with my mom, I almost can't believe it actually happened. I can't believe I used to live in one of those tall houses and could look up at the sky every day. It's as if Metro was always my home... But I still miss that world we lost.
l04_outdoor_diary_1=The Red Line is one of the biggest and strongest states in the Metro, occupying almost a whole line. But for as long as I can remember, the Reds always used to preach that their goal was the installation of communism throughout the whole of the Metro, the restoration of a destroyed state that used to be based on the ideals of equality and justice. The problem is, the independent stations keep their distance from the Red Line as best as they can, which means they can't restore the Red State without strife. Yes, the Reds are no angels, but what the Nazis are doing is regular horror. And I am happy to have an ally like Pavel. Even if he's Red.
l04_outdoor_narration_DSC=もう少しでシアター駅だ。メトロへの入り口はかなり近いはずだ。距離はわずかだが、地上を通っていかなければならない。そこでは、一瞬でも気を抜けば終わりだ
l04_outdoor_narration_DSC_short=もう少しでシアター駅だ。メトロへの入り口はかなり近いはずだ。距離はわずかだが、地上を通っていかなければならない。そこでは、一瞬でも気を抜けば終わりだ

l04_plane=共鳴
l04_riga_diary_0=What was that? Strange shadows and voices... Whispers, weeps – they were silent, and yet they still resound inside my head… There are lots of tunnels in the Metro associated with terrifying legends, but I've never heard anything quite like this, and I hope I'll never anything like this from now on. We got incredibly lucky in escaping that place with our lives. 
l04_riga_diary_1=Rizhskaya… Back home at the Exhibition we always considered this station's dwellers somehow... unlucky. They always used to be in trouble – be it their pigs catching some mysterious bug, their tunnel ceilings leaking, or their merchants getting too immersed in the celebration of a good deal at the Market and drinking all the money away. The people of Riga are nice and hospitable, but they sure are clumsy. We used to pity them and poke fun at them a bit, for we were on top of things, We, at the Exhibition, knew life... And now I actually envy them. They live in peace, they haven't even hear of the Dark Ones, and even those who did never believed what they heard. But if I fail, the Dark Ones will wipe this station out in an instant. And these happy clumsy people with their peaceful clumsy life will be gone. There will be blood and emptiness. I've got to hurry. 
l04_riga_diary_2=There's a saying in the Metro: “Nothing worse than a chance fellow traveler, but nobody else to rely on either”. This Burbon guy surely is strange. Why would he need me? He obviously knows these tunnels like the back of his hand. Somebody told him that “that shit” does not affect me, and he bought it? I don't believe it myself and he does? Well, no use thinking about it. I'll be quite happy if he just gets me past the Market without trying to quietly snuff me in a dark tunnel.
l05_lost_tunnel_diary_0=Bourbon is definitely not as simple as he tries to seem. Yes, he is rude, and his sense of humor is rough at best. But the things he tells about his exploits and, even more, the things he prefers not to tell, prove he is way too sharp for a regular smuggler, and his knowledge of the situation not just at the nearest stations, but even the Ring as a whole, is mind-boggling. All the passages and tunnels, even the long abandoned ones, are well known to him, he is quite at home in combat, which means he saw his share of dangerous encounters... He's definitely much more than a regular smuggler, of that I am sure. 
l05_lost_tunnel_diary_1=These tunnels definitely are cursed... Something really is happening there. Those voices... Perhaps, they are just illusions – but I am sure that if we didn't get dragged out of there then, we would have stayed there forever. It happened so that I saved Bourbon, a stranger to me, while somebody else, whom I was a stranger to, saved me. We are used to not trusting others implicitly, but if each of us fights on his own, we're going to be nothing more than a free meal for the mutants. And still... I'm not sure whom am I afraid more of.  
l05_theatre=ボリショイ
l05_theatre_3d_text_1=Alms for the man shunned by the "Brave New World"
l05_theatre_diary_0=Pavel needs some time to set everything up. The citizens of other stations need a permit to enter the Red Line. The state in permanent preparation for war readily sees a spy in any outsider. So I have some time to look around the Theater. This station is a real legend of the Metro – not unlike Polis, the difference being that while Polis gathered most of the surviving scientists, the Theater is considered to be the cultural capital of the Metro.
l05_theatre_diary_1=No wonder! The world-famous Bolshoi Theater is right above that station! There are rumors that there are underground passages from its basement into the Metro, and that's the reason why many of its actors and other staff were able to save themselves on Judgment Day. They founded a new Bolshoi down here at the station. It is the theater rumors of which reach even the farthest corners of the Metro. And since the habitable world ends where the Metro lines end, you could say that the New Bolshoi is also known around the world. Some say it actually preserves the tradition of its great predecessor... They say that the Earth continues to spin while the Bolshoi still puts on the shows... How I wished to see one of those! Perhaps, I finally got my chance?

l06_revolution_2_diary_0=One thing is completely certain now: the Red Line is preparing for war. Without making pompous statements or fanning hysteria like the Reich usually does, they are steadily assembling the strongest army in the Metro ever. And the very silence accompanying their war preparations seems more sinister to me than all the Führer's speeches...
l06_revolution_2_diary_1=Looks like the Red Line's General Secretary Moskvin does not do much decision-making. It seems that he himself is Korbut's hostage... The one-eyed General holds him in a deadlock with one hand, while using the other to move the pieces on his huge chessboard – the whole Metro. But why does the Secretary, supposedly capable of laying the general off or even having him executed, tolerate his insolence and yield to his demands? What gives Korbut strength? Knowledge, perhaps? I just have to catch up with Pavel and he'll tell me everything. We'll see how he is going to continue singing his songs of equality and brotherhood, of creating a just state for everyone... That traitor!
l06_revolution_2_diary_2=Justice... Equality... Peace... Moskvin knows how to hit where it hurts. It might seem strange, but they are right: if we don't reach an agreement, don't stop fighting, we'll finish ourselves off much sooner that any mutants would. Communists, just like Nazis, use the bunker located by the Order as bait. The common folk swallow it hook, line and sinker... And that's all. War. Prosperity has to be bought with a price of blood. For humanity to have a bright future, one more generation has to discard its present...
l06_revolution_2_diary_3=I must find the last surviving Dark One. The Order dictates that I eliminate it. That is my mission. Kill it, like I killed all its kin. I'm prohibited from reflecting on this order, I have no right to doubt, but... After all I recalled under the effect of Korbut's serum... I no longer know if I still want to carry that order out.

l08_market_diary_0=Yes, I'd never get here without Bourbon. He's at home everywhere and he knows everyone. Sure, as I suspected, the locals did have some old gripes with him, but looks like Bourbon sorted it out. Which is hardly surprising, since Prospekt Mira belongs to Hansa, a trading union of the Circle line stations, the richest of the Metro's “states”. The citizens of Hansa, their wealth ensured through trade with other “states” and free stations, understandably value profit above anything. I think Bourbon had betrayed their trust before, and now he surely had to promise he'd pay them back with interest. The only problem is that there's a saying: “Better to be indebted to the Devil than to Hansa”. He's going to have one tough time paying them back…
l08_market_diary_1=Filters, filters, filters... It seems like the Stalkers never talk about anything else. They keep droning about filters being all but unobtainable now, not just the unused, but even adequately refitted. That the refitted, being the bastards that they are, don't put enough coal into them, and that you have to reach for a new one as soon as you finish attaching the previous to your mask... But whatever they say about the filters, Stalkers value them more than the bullets. No wonder, that, too: you might sneak by on the Surface without ever being found out by the mutants, but there's no escaping the poisoned air...
l08_water_tunnel=ダーク・ウォーター
l08_water_tunnels_diary_0=Somebody told me once, that the Metro stands on water. Usually it can't get inside the tunnels. The lived-in stations have pumps working day and night to remove the water seeping in from the outside. But there also are places like this, where the tunnels have turned into subterranean rivers and the stations into islands. That won't stop me. I will continue my pursuit even on water. The Tretyakovskaya is already in sight.
l08_water_tunnels_diary_1=Some people don't understand why the whole Metro isn't still flooded. The others wonder how humanity could last for twenty years in a shelter intended to be used for a few months at most. Some say that man is just as hard to kill as roaches or rats. But I don't think that's the only reason. I always thought we exist for a purpose. We just don't yet completely get it.

l08_water_tunnels_narration_NAME=ダーク・ウォーター
l09_dead_city_diary_0=From the very day I ended up in the Metro, I've been dreaming of going back up. Seeing that magical city of my dreams again, the living city of my childhood memories. But what I actually see on the Surface is an apparition, a nightmare. I can't recognize it. I can't believe I used to live here… How my Mother and I lived here. How happy we were. Even her face... Can't remember any of it. How I hoped that her face, her smile would come back even for a tiniest moment when I went up here... It didn't happen. I'm all alone, and I have no home but Metro. 
l09_dead_city_diary_1=It's so strange to think that man used to be the sole master of this world. Now is is owned by totally different creatures, and the sorry few remaining of us have to hide like rats, like cockroaches in our holes in the ground. The fields are burned out and will never bear crops again, the forests stand withered, blackened and dead, the rivers are like dead, congealed blood, even the air itself is capable of killing a man in mere minutes. Our cities are in ruins and populated by monsters. We did all we could to never be able to come back up here again. All that we amount to now is mere marauders. Searching hurriedly, like thieves, through the rubble that used to be our homes and steal anything that wasn't stolen through these twenty years back to our hideout. Our Metro. 
l09_dead_city_diary_2=God, am I glad to see another living soul, even though that soul appears to be Bourbon! And it looks like he was happy to see me, too – and we aren't friends or anything, just chance co-travelers... Here, on the Surface, you can't help but feel that we, people, have got to keep together, to rely on each other. Because everything out there is... Hostile. Lethally dangerous. Alien. 
l09_venice=ヴェニス
l09_venice_diary_0=The subterranean Venice is a strange city. Three stations half-flooded with groundwater. Old-timers say there used to be another city by that name... They also say it was the most beautiful city in the world. Who knows what has become of it?
l09_venice_diary_1=Venice... I've been told that subterranean Venice is a city of thieves and murderers, but I found regular people here. l10_swamp_diary_0=I feel like I sailed into a maelstrom – events that I don't fully understand start happening all around me and suddenly I'm dragged down to the bottom by their current... Wherever I go, everybody around me keeps talking of war. Some are getting ready for it, others – running from it. But everyone believes it's coming. Miller, Führer, Moskvin, the people at the Theater and the refugees from the Red Line. The damp and rusty air of the Metro smells of blood and doom. It is not my war. I wonder if anything at all can be done to prevent it...
l10_swamp_diary_2=If this subterranean island gets dragged into the meat-grinder of the coming war, all this will be done for. Gondola rides in the tunnel rivers, swimmers and fishermen, the amazingly useless art galleries, all these children who grew up in the dark but are shining themselves with the light of hope... l10_swamp_narration_NAME=沼地
l11_dry_diary_0=Are there any loan sharks in the whole wide Metro Bourbon doesn't owe money to or dangerous kingpins he never crossed? Damn, this guy has the whole world on his tail! And this time it seems like his luck has run out. I don't care about him... At least, I shouldn't. And yet, for some reason, I can't just leave him to his own devices. Sukhoi, my stepfather, once told me: “You save someone once, you have to keep saving them forever”. You can't help feeling responsible for someone you didn't let die. They grow into you. That's why he took me in when my Mother died... And, probably, that's why I can't leave Bourbon now.  
l11_dry_diary_1=It seems that men like Bourbon are born with a noose on their necks. They spend their lives walking the edge, risking everything every day – and they think they can keep it up forever. But you can't cheat death. You make a habit out of walking the abyss' edge, one day you fall... Why am I telling myself all of this? To persuade myself that I'm not guilty of his death? That he had it coming anyway, sooner or later, because he made his own fate? No... I'm doing this to drown out that little voice in my head that keeps nagging that I could have saved him... Could have changed his life somehow… He was not such an evil man, after all. It's never us, it's the world we live in... And what right does Khan have to judge him anyway!

l12_Circus_diary_0=The Reds were quite possibly hoping to enter a station completely wiped out by the virus, but it took too long to do that and they got impatient. They did not just wait for the outcome, they hastened it. The survivors say that when the purging of the station started, the Reds allowed some supposedly contaminated locals to escape to the neighboring station, the Oktyabrskaya-Koltsevaya. But those escapees were closely followed by the execution squads. If not for a team of Order fighters who just happened to be at Koltsevaya at the time and repelled the Reds, by now they would have two stations and Hansa would be cut in half. But the Order managed to avert that.
l12_Circus_diary_1=Now the Oktyabrskaya-Koltsevaya belonging to Hansa is a cross between a hospital and quarantine zone. All the refugees from the neighboring station and everyone who had contacted them are being put into plastic boxes. And that's it. Nobody tries to treat them. Everyone suspected of being infected sits in his plastic cage and his death sits across, playing stares with him. A minute of this game lasts an eternity. The losers are infected, die and get burned. Death is too good of a player to give his opponents many chances of winning.
l12_Circus_narration_DSC=パズルのピースが崩れ落ち、そして言葉にできないほど巨大で恐ろしい絵が現れた。みんなにこの事を伝えなければ、だが僕は未だに、レッドラインがオクチャブレスカヤを感染させたという事実を信じられなかった。疑う事を知らない平和な駅に住む人たちは、未知の殺人ウィルスに侵された。その後、奴らの消毒部隊が現れ、駅を救うという名目で、疫病と感染者を排除した。女も、子供も、老人も、感染拡大を防ぐために排除された…　これが事実なら、僕とアンナも感染したかもしれない。僕たちは死の淵から救出されたが、長く生きられるかどうかはわからない。

l12_ghost_diary_0=I'm used to danger. Used to the fragility of human life. I saw, with my own eyes, monsters that shouldn't exist. I walked the ruins of a city populated by the dead. When he's around, everything – all I know about the world, people, death, even myself – starts seeming nonsensical. I have no point of reference, nobody to rely on but Khan himself. Another random encounter... Or, perhaps, not so random, after all?
l12_ghost_diary_1=There are but a few of scraps of memories, like faded pictures, remaining of my life in the Surface... And I don't remember the trains capable of running the tracks, filling the tunnels  with their noise and lights, their windows full of smiling human faces... For me, the trains are just wrecks of the old world: carriages we live in, their complex machinery dismembered to make our impotent trinkets... Our new world is built out of the debris of the old one. The ancestors are not quite dead, it's as if they;re still around, invisible, always watching us... Unable to find their peace.
l12_ghost_diary_2=To say the truth, I first took Khan for a madman. Then I got scared of him. Now I admire him. There are things in the Metro that eye can't see, but that does not mean they are not real. If Khan didn't take me through these strange reaches of the Metro, if he didn't help me cross the invisible hurdles, didn't warn of the mysterious dangers, my journey would have ended long ago. It's no wonder that I believed in him and told him my story. I have so many questions for him – and he seems to have all the answers. 
l13_anomaly_diary_0=I remember Korbut calling the operation they were going to carry out at Oktyabrskaya "an experiment"... What if the Reds are simply distracting Order and Hansa, all the while preparing a much more powerful, overwhelming attack? I wanted to be a soldier. To protect humanity. But all the blood I spilled didn't help me prevent the war that's already started. I didn't become a superhero capable of killing the villain and saving the whole world. Not that I didn't dream of it. Everyone does. But when the war starts, most turn out to be just cannon fodder. Many don't even survive their first engagement. And I, as a little gear, can only spin on the predetermined axis and watch the massive flywheel of slaughter unwind. That, perhaps, is why I am going with Khan. This might be my only chance to change anything.

l14_cursed_diary_0=Once, this used to be a regular station – lived-in, even prosperous. One of those stations where not only heavily armed fighters can survive, but also old men, and women, and even children. Then the mutants came, as if from nowhere. They were innumerable. The Cursed – sure, then it was still called its old name, fought back with all it had. But the means proved inadequate. The defenders were forced to abandon all of their roadblocks in the tunnels one after another, then they barricaded the main platform and had their last stand there. They fought to the last child they were able to evacuate to the neighbor station, the last old lady carried there. To the last bullet. And when the bullets were gone, those at the barricades all stayed there. Then the Cursed station got its name – from the saved wives and children of those who'd stayed there forever. And that is what awaits our Exhibition if I don't pull my task off. And, perhaps, not just the Exhibition, but the whole of Metro.
l15_armory_diary_0=There are many in the Metro who hate the Reds – because they are afraid of them. The reds always go hungry, even though they work round the clock. They are told they toil for a better future, but year after year their lives get even more miserable. They fight with abandon, as if not afraid of death at all, and their commanders just throw them away, piling their bodies up to block enemy gun emplacements, spending their lives as if their charges were immortal. But they are mortal, and they die – of exhaustion, of overworking, of bullets fired by their enemies and their own commissars ordered to shoot those retreating. They are told they are superior, that they are made of steel, not flesh… And that is why I pity them. What do they live and die for? The idols of the past are long gone, but they are kept in the dark about it. The slogans they communicate with are meaningless in the new world. They are prohibited from speaking or even thinking freely. Anyone asking questions is deemed a traitor. Anyone who says life's better outside the Red Line is a spy and a saboteur. You have to hide everything human about you and become just like the rest of them. But there also are people like Andrew the Blacksmith here. People who refuse to abandon hope and who persevere. If I were in his shoes, I'd be long gone. Why is he still here? Is he afraid of being shot making his escape? 
l15_armory_diary_1=I was not wrong about Andrew – I just grossly underestimated him. He is not afraid of running. He just does things that take much more guts than that. Andrew helps others escape the red Line, risking his own life every minute. He and his friends saved lots of refugees using a network of abandoned passages and forgotten tunnels, which the Reds are still ignorant about. The refugees usually take this literal and at the same time figurative underground railroad to get from the Red Line to the Metro proper... But for me Andrew is working it in reverse. I need to get to the front lines of the never-ending war between the Red Line and the Reich. I'm taking the train which is delivering a fresh load of cannon fodder to the meat grinder. The important part is to know when to jump off…

l16_frontline_diary_0=The red Line has no worse enemy than the Fourth Reich. They do believe a different thing here, though:  supposedly, it's enough for all mutants to be eradicated for things to magically fix themselves. Racial purity is no longer relevant, these Nazis are all for genetic purity. And since the norm is defined by the politicians, anyone can be deemed mutant. It's the stormtroopers who ultimately get to decide who gets to live and who dies. And this fight can last forever. l19_defense_diary_0=Here I feel just like back home, at the exhibition. All in vain. The best they can hope for, the best WE can hope for, is a brief respite before we're all engulfed in eternal shadow. And still they don't surrender. I should go, too – time is running short. 
l19_defense_diary_1=I am wading through a literal swamp of human blood  We kill other people so easily... We kill them for a place to live in, for a bite of meat, for an abstract idea. Our whole civilization was built on human bones, but even after we've taken it apart down to its foundations, pushed the brink of extinction by the horrific abominations created by this new world, we still continue killing each other. Those who died today probably had families, too. Friends. Hell, their parents might still be alive! They died protecting their station from the mutants, not other people, but seen through the iron sights the beasts and humans alike looks like so much paper cutout targets. And here I am, trying to save the people from the beasts... Just to give us another shot at finishing themselves off. 
l19_defense_diary_2=The children of Metro… Sometimes I feel that they, who were born underground and who have never seen the Sun, are a whole new species. This child has just been through hell, he stayed alive by sheer luck – and he's not falling apart in the slightest. He speaks calmly and rationally... I remember the day the station where my Mother and I lived then right after we went down to the Metro, was attacked by rats... When Mother died... And the rats, they... And I was saved by Sukhoi... He says I didn't talk for several months after that. And I remember nothing about that time. Nothing at  all. While this little boy… Perhaps, the Metro will temper us. Perhaps, the generations raised without the Sun, but also without fear, will claim the Earth. If I give them a chance. 
l19_defense_diary_3=She offers me some bullets for saving her child. As if I had a choice. But, apparently, what used to be natural before, looks strange now, and what would gross out the world then, does not raise any brows today. What do I do? Decline the reward – and insult  her? Take the reward – and acknowledge that I saved a child just to rake up a reward?  The days when a human life, a child's life was priceless and couldn't be paid for, are long gone. Today we all have a price. The bullets I'm given for saving the boy seem like a good deal, usually the price for a life is only one bullet. Just enough to take it. 
l19_polis=ポリス
l19_polis_diary_0=僕はこの子に、あの炎の中をどうやって生き延びたのか尋ねた。単純に、ミサイルがダークワンの街に降り注ぐとき、彼はそこに居なかったのだ。ダークワン…　何故このような知的生命体が突如として現れたのか、我々は疑問を抱き続けていた。人類は進化に何百万年と掛けたというのに、何故ダークワンたちはわずか数年でここまで進化したのだろう？答えは簡単だった。彼らは我々だった。人類から生まれたのだ。僕の義父、アレックスの言うとおりだった。彼らは進化の次の段階だ。僕たちは祖先で、ダークワンは子孫。人類は戦争のために大量の武器を作った…　そのうちの1つが彼らを生み出したのだ。彼らは我々とは違う。人類が作り出した兵器が彼らを強くした。人類は、汚染された荒野を離れ、ダークワンはそこで生きる術を学んだ。放射線を吸収して生き続けているのだ。彼らは生まれた後、すぐに世界に入ってこない。しばらくの間、夢の中に存在し続け、先に生まれた者たちから学び、成長する。僕は彼らの家を破壊したが、若者たちは地下で眠っていた。植物園の近く、テレビ塔の地下にD6と繋がっている地下施設があった。ミサイルが落ちた時、入り口のトンネルが陥落したのだ。世界に入るための準備がほぼ整っていたダークワンたちは、その中に閉じ込められてしまった。彼らの代わりに、この幼きダークワンは母親の断末摩と爆発音で目を覚ました。彼は何が起きてるのか理解できなかった。世界のことは何も知らず、なんの備えもできていない。仲間を探したが、見つからなかった。なぜなら、僅かな生存者たちは眠り続けていたからだ。彼らの目覚めの時は訪れたが、それに気付くことは無く、まもなく飢えて死んでしまうだろう。目を開けることもないまま…。カーンがミラーをどうやって説得したかは知らないが、冷静さの象徴ともいうべき彼は、ダークワンを見ても銃に手を掛けることは無かった。その次に起きた事はレッドラインの計画以上に驚かされた。D6にダークワンが居たのだ！カーンはダークワンは戦前に人工的に作られたと仮説を立てた。しかし、何のために？放射線への免疫とテレパシー能力を持つスーパーソルジャーだろうか？そうかもしれない…　だが神は、彼らに魂を吹き込んだ…
l19_polis_narration_DSC=彼は…　最後の1人では無かった！僕は、彼がどれだけ仲間に会いたがっているか、どれだけ仲間を解放したがっているのか理解してる…　だが…　彼はもう少し待ってくれることに同意した。彼は先に我々を助けてくれる。和平会談に間に合えば、ダークワンがモスクビンとコルブトの企みを明らかにする。もしかしたら…　彼らの狂気を終わらせられるかもしれない！これが最後のチャンスだ
l19_polis_narration_DSC_short=彼は…　最後の1人では無かった！僕は、彼がどれだけ仲間に会いたがっているか、どれだけ仲間を解放したがっているのか理解してる…　だが…　彼はもう少し待ってくれることに同意した。彼は先に我々を助けてくれる。和平会談に間に合えば、ダークワンがモスクビンとコルブトの企みを明らかにしてくれる。もしかしたら…　彼らの狂気を終わらせられるかもしれない！これが最後のチャンスだ
l19_polis_narration_NAME=武力による平和
l20_d6_defense=D6
l20_d6_diary_0=We must stop Korbut, prevent him from taking D6. If we fail, all we've been through after the War, all the hardships we braved surviving all these years, all the sacrifices... Everything would have been in vain. Could it be that the spring that has finally melted the decades-old ice on the surface, promising us a new hope of leaving the darkness of the underground and reaching out to the sun again, is also in vain? Could it happen that there won't be anyone left to welcome that spring? I can't believe this. Hope still lives while the Order holds D6, while even a single one of us still draws breath. We will stop Korbut – at any cost. For our friends and families. For the whole of the Metro. For the spring we've all been waiting for. For the future.
l20_d6_diary_1=Now I know. There were never any stores of food or medical supplies in D6 to speak of. Miller just didn't want to tell us that: he kept opening door after door hoping to find what he'd promised. Our chance for salvation. But all he found were containers with viruses. With bacteria. Spores of death. The ancestors left us a vast stockpile of tabooed weapons, nothing else. And we opened Pandora's box. Korbut knew this. He never cared about food or other supplies. Hungry people are easier to control. They always want more. We opened Pandora's box, and we're going to seal it back. Or die. All of us...
l20_d6_narration_DSC=彼は去った。なすべきことをして…　家族に会いに行ったのだ。僕に何も言う権利はない。残された人類は、最終戦争で互いを殺しあっている。これは彼の戦争ではない。僕はただ彼が我々を許してくれることを願う…　僕が彼の兄弟、姉妹、母親、父親にしたことを。
l20_d6_narration_DSC_short=彼は去った。なすべきことをして…　家族に会いに行ったのだ。僕に何も言う権利はない。残された人類は、最終戦争で互いを殺しあっている。これは彼の戦争ではない。僕はただ彼らが我々を許してくれることを願う…　僕が彼の兄弟、姉妹、母親、父親にしたことを。
l20_d6_narration_NAME=最後の戦い
l21_outpost_diary_0=I remember how happy I was to see Bourbon in the empty city – another living human in this land of the dead. Where did that feeling go? Here, on the Surface, among the dead stones and petrified bones, danger oozes from everything – the mutant animals, the irradiated soul, the poisoned air… And despite all that there's no greater danger here than man. And as soon as we pry a tiny piece of living space from this hostile new world, we build a fortress there, not a peaceful colony. 
l21_outpost_diary_1=The Nazis were in a hurry to finish off the defenders of the Cursed station. They weren't even prepared to wait till the animals do this for them. Of course, they need the station, they need the living space. But whom would they populate the station “liberated” this way with? So few children are born in the Metro, and those who actually grow up are even fewer... Sukhoi once told me that fifteen million people used to live in Moscow alone.  And now there are not more than fifty thousand of us in the Metro – and, perhaps, on all the planet. And yet we continue murdering each other with gust, as if we still number in millions. Only ashes remain of the six billion people that once populated the earth. Ashes and dust. They are all around, they crunch beneath our boots, they disguise themselves as sand and clay, dust and snow. And we richly water them with fresh blood, as if hoping to grow some crops out of such soil. 
l22_black_diary_0=We all wear impenetrable armor. Even after taking off one's vest, or all the clothes altogether, one still stays clad in in head to toe. We are afraid of opening up to people, showing our feelings, afraid of someone understanding our thoughts. We hide our faces wearing gas masks, but there's one more mask beneath that one. Uhlman – the indomitable optimist, the light-hearted jester... I had only seen his real face when his comrade died. Tired to death, almost desperate – that's how he looked… For only a second. A moment later he had his armor back, and was the his regular funny self again. I didn't try to get him open up again. It's not the Metro way. And I'm certainly not opening up for anyone myself.  
l22_black_diary_1=Metro kills the belief in miracles, but teaches you to live without hope. And still, I can't find any explanation for me being able to successfully negotiate the labyrinth of the Black station, full of Nazis mind you, short of a miracle. As if I was led by someone...  Was it my stupid, undying hope? Or, perhaps, fate itself? 
l23_polis_diary_0=For as long as I really remember myself, I always had the dream of visiting Polis. The hard and hopeless life underground wears man down, makes him a savage, a beast – and only in Polis does he manage to keep a resemblance to the great people of the past, the ones who had the planet in their pocket. Polis is the last refuge of the scientists, the educators, the artists – everyone who'd be deemed useless by the other stations. The last citadel of culture and civilization. And… And the stories told in the Metro insist that electric lights were on there day and night through. Just like it used to be in our past, that's never to return… Polis did deliver on all the outrageous expectations I had. Vast, shining, cleaned to perfection… A real underground city. Its four stations united into one rhyme with the halls of the ancient temples I saw in history books. By just being here you start to feel this incredible energy… Start to believe that humanity will once more rise from its knees. If there is a force in the Metro capable of saving the Exhibition from the Dark Ones, it must reside here.  
l23_polis_diary_1=Who said that stupid and pompous phrase about responsibility coming with power?! I thought that Polis was the pinnacle of all power in the Metro. Its guards armed to the tooth, its incredible reputation among any factions and stations, its stores of food and ammunition, its wealth and prosperity… Polis is the hub of the universe. But, apparently, this hub does not care one bit for some backwater station. The Council  didn't even want to waste time hearing us out, but after reluctantly agreeing to do so, it just lazily stamped “declined” on the desperate plea of the Exhibition. And it wasn't just my request that was declined – they did it to Miller, the head of the Rangers. I though it was all over. If not for Miller and his people… The Rangers are not called an Order for nothing. They are a veritable knightly order, a state within a state, a brotherhood of people sworn to oaths, adherence to which they value higher than their lives. And the Rangers are sworn to protecting the Metro from all the dangers  threatening its dwellers, no matter what station they live at or what they believe in. 
l24_alley_diary_0=The Rangers call their base Sparta, and themselves, either jokingly or seriously – Spartans. They do fit the part, mind you: ready to die rather than surrender. They are also few, just like their historical counterparts. Each of them is a seasoned fighter, worth ten regular soldiers, but they just don't have the manpower to fight a full-blown war or stand against the legions of the Dark Ones. That's why Miller's plan is our only chance. Find a still operable missile launch site, command the missiles and burn the Dark One nest to cinders. If we pull it off, our casualties should be minimal, while my home station, and whole Metro with it, saved. Seems like a perfect plan… But something is worrying me. There seems to be a weak spot in it, something is not right. I can't shake the feeling that we're making a mistake.    
l24_alley_diary_1=I read and re-read all the books we had at the station till they fell apart. I always rushed the traders coming home from the far stations to be the first to try and barter for the few greasy tomes they could have brought… Even though nobody else would ever want them here. I read anything. When you live sixty meters under ground, books become your only windows. I worshiped books. So try and imagine my feelings at the sight of the Great Library! The shrine to all the important books ever written in human history. But I must not forget the reason that brought be to this place. If I let myself get distracted, start browsing these half-rotten moldy tomes, the Library will swallow me up whole and forever…
l26_depository_diary_0=Knowledge is power. A worn-out slogan. Before the war nobody probably ever thought of its actual meaning anymore. Knowledge was available to anyone. My stepfather told me a portable phone could answer any question at a flick of a finger… Nobody cared much about studying, searching for new information and remembering it anymore. And then, in a singular moment, all the information vanished. The phone lines went dead, the phone batteries discharged, and those who were reluctant to admit knowledge into their heads, were left with empty heads. Knowledge became power, a precious commodity again... Too precious. Here, in the Great Library, more knowledge about the Earth and people is probably stored than anywhere else. But each letter read from its vast vaults has to be paid for in blood.
l27_archives_diary_0=What are these Librarians? We gave these creatures this funny name just because they were way too horrible to remain unnamed. One thing is certain: these are no mere beasts. I have no idea the clay did radiation molded these abominations out of, but they are definitely too smart for regular mutated animals. I see a glitter of intelligence in their eyes... And we don't know what is it that they see in our eyes. But is you don't run, don't fight and just keep staring directly at one of these – something happens... And you get to keep your life. Even though one of these can crush an experience and well-armed fighter like a bug. Could it be that when looking into human eyes they recall, however vaguely, that once they were humans, too?..
l28_driving_diary_0=Khan… I owe everything to him. If not for him, I'd rot in that anomaly tunnel. I'd never be able to reach the Library. If not for him, Miller would never pay attention to me… I don't really know what kind of man he is, I don't even know if he's a human at all. Yes, I was sent on this path by Hunter, but it's Khan who walks me through it. It's weird, but even Miller's subordinates who seem to acknowledge no authority other than their indomitable Colonel's, pay heed to this wandering philosopher and believe him. He has some mysterious power over human souls... I wish I could meet him again. I have too many questions nobody else could answer.
l28_driving_diary_1=Why a church? Is it just the sturdiness of its walls, or do Miller's fighters believe it could protect the, better than anything else? It's weird that even those who stand firmly on the ground looking death in the face and, by all accounts, must be quite used to it, still seek protection from heavens. Rangers don't speak of it, but I saw many of them wearing undercloth crosses. I heard someone tell that the world turned inside-out after the Apocalypse, and while hell ended under the skies, the people had to find refuge where hell used to be. That's why there's supposedly no better refuge on the Surface than the old churches. I don't know about that... But these icons and frescoes, adorning the church walls, instill some kind of calmness even in me. As if we, the sinners who had the divinely created world destroyed, can still hope for absolution. Can still pray for salvation...  
l30_darkstar_diary_0=My strange dreams still continue. I am no longer sure they are just dreams anymore – and it never happened to me before. The dreams seem more like visions... And they become more and more vivid, still holding sway over my conscience even after I wake up – even I still can't understand their meaning. Yet, time after time, I wake up with the same heavy feeling: the premonition of a catastrophe. One brought about by my own actions. 
l32_cave_diary_0=Everything seems to go well. Uhlman keeps up his jokes, Miller keeps threatening him with extra time on duty… The goal is close by, and nothing can stop us now. We win every encounter. Hunter was right when he said that there never was and never be a more terrifying predator on Earth than human is. 
l32_cave_diary_1=I didn't really cause their death – and I still feel guilty. I was too eager to celebrate the easy time we had with the last leg of our journey, and that brought about trouble. I couldn't be in the right place in the right time, couldn't help my comrade in time, bringing him back form the brink of death... I brought these brave souls into this adventure that happened to become their last. Our team, small as it was, is growing even smaller. When I look at my palms in the dancing light of a bonfire, it seems they are covered with blood.  
l32_cave_diary_2=I sure heard stories about the Metro builders were not the first digging tunnels and galleries in the ground deep under Moscow. Hidden passages were being build under the city in the times of the first tzars, but the workers who built those, reportedly, encountered even older caves and burrows, built in times immemorial. The nameless creators of those vanished millenia ago, leaving only endless corridors going from nowhere to nowhere again behind. And now, perhaps a hundred generations later I, the  last man alive, am tentatively walking along the same path. 
l33_d6_diary_0=It's incredible, but these long abandoned galleries have preserved the technology in them much better than any of the populated parts of the Metro! The monorail opening its doors for the first time in decades, started and carried us to our goal completely smoothly, as if serviced the day before. There is truth in saying that time eats away metal and stone, man and its creations – but our fathers built for the ages, and if their work isn't destroyed by their own offspring, it's bout to stay there for thousands of years. 
l33_d6_diary_1=I still find it hard to believe that all of this was built by humans, not giants from the ancient fairy-tales. And it's not just me, even the larger-than-life, ever jovial Uhlman noticeably shrunk when he considered the sheer size of this place. What was this complex supposed to be, what was it built for? Where did its personnel go, and why hasn't anyone in the Metro ever heard of it? A carpet of spent cartridges on the floor; one would think a fierce battle took place here – but there are no bodies or bones. What could have transpired here?
l33_d6_diary_2=What are these creatures, and can they really be called that? Did they emerge in the ruins of the old world by themselves, or were they created? There's nothing natural in them, they are reverting at all levels. They must be wiped out before they destroy us. Just like the Dark Ones. Either this world will become ours again, or the creatures that entered it after us will destroy us all and continue driving the evolution forward with us becoming a minor side note on its pages. We have no choice. We have to win back the fief of our ancestors with fire and sword. We will claim what is our rightful  inheritance, and we will win this final battle – or perish.   
l33_d6_diary_3=Once again we're going to the Surface, and this time we come prepared. Uhlman's joking about our strides making the earth tremble. But I feel like actually feel it tremble. After all we had come through, nothing and nobody will stop us. The enemy is going down, turned into dust and ashes, the way we also treated our enemies… One thing eludes me: why don't the Dark Ones try and stop us? Are we coming straight into their ambush? The weird premonitions still  pestering me are becoming even more sinister… 
l36_ostankino_diary_0=One labored step after another we're rising up the tower. We come from underground, and we're storming the heavens, lead clouds all around like impenetrable walls. The steps are badly decayed and crumble beneath our feet. The wind seems to be strong enough to peel our skins off our bones. We aren't welcome in the heavens, our place is down there. 
l36_ostankino_diary_1=I'm all alone now. I have to do the most critical part myself. Nobody to shove the responsibility onto, nobody to as for help. The fate of the human race is in my hands  - as well as the fate of the Dark Ones. And with each step taken my assuredness in justice of my actions dwindles. With each step I'm asking myself more and more questions – the kind of those which could be answered by Khan only. But Khan isn't here, either. I'm alone on the top of the world. And I can see things I couldn't see from anywhere else, hear things I couldn't even imagine... I feel the presence of the Dark Ones. I hear them. Strange images crowd my mind, echoes of alien thoughts echo in my head. I know the Dark Ones can enter the minds of men, driving their victims insane... Could this be what's happening to me? I must make it... I must stay sane. I must target the missiles. I hope I can...

2033\intro=<time=4080> I was born in Moscow,<time=5740> <time=8200> but I remember nothing of that time.<time=10280> <time=12400> I was just an infant when the old world was destroyed<time=15340> <time=15340> in the flames of nuclear fire<time=17340> <time=25480> I, along with 40 thousand others,<time=28240> <time=28520> were saved by retreating to the Metro stations<time=31600> <time=31600> deep under the city.<time=33600> <time=37040> Now, 20 years had passed,<time=39360> <time=39840> and going up into the embrace of an endless winter<time=42660> <time=42860> was left to a few brave souls.<time=45140> <time=53860> The Metro was our home,<time=55580> <time=57020> and our fortress against the nightmarish mutants<time=59780> <time=59790> who roamed the tunnels.<time=61780> <time=70480> Still, we never gave up hope<time=72820> <time=72830> that we would return to the surface.<time=74820> <time=76100> But one day, a new threat appeared...<time=78820> <time=78830> and we found ourselves in a war<time=81180> <time=81190> to determine the very existence of our species...<time=85160> <time=85170>  <time=85180>

2033\outro_bad=賢人はかつてこう言った。「同胞の愛の為に戦争を引き起こしたものは敵の前に散った」と。俺は家族を友人を故郷ーーメトロを守るために戦い、そして勝った。だが最近俺は不思議に思う。ダークワンを地球全体から焼き払ったとき、何かも同時に失われてしまったのか？
2033\outro_good=H.G.ウェルズはこう記した「我々が戦争を終わらせなければ、戦争が我々を終わらせるだろう」と。俺はなんとかして戦争を終わらせることができた。だが今回は、なにがDark Onesの代わりになるのか俺には分からない。だが、俺の旅に憑りついた奇妙なヴィジョンが、Dark Onesからの我々への救済なのではないかと最近気づいた。俺が連中と最初に交流したのかは分からない。だが、最後にはならないはずだ。そして未来――我々の未来、永遠に続く地下鉄のように我々の前に引き伸ばされた未来。

2033\voices\l02_exhibition\soldier_4_3=So, we were transporting cargo once, with the usual detachment: two men ahead, three in the middle and one behind.  Everything was fine until we had to go through a spur tunnel.  There was this stench in there...and some kind of mist.  You couldn't see more than two meters ahead.  So, we tied a rope to the belt of the rear guard, to one of the center guards' and one of the fore guards, so not to get lost in the fog.  
2033\voices\l02_exhibition\soldier_4_4=Safety line.  Again, by the book.
2033\voices\l02_exhibition\soldier_4_5=Fuck the book--this is what I'm telling you.  We start walking.  Halfway down the spur, the rope attached to the rear guard suddenly goes slack,  We yell to the guy--nothing,  Tolyan, who's in the middle, pulls the rope to him--it looks like it's been bitten off.  The rear guard is gone--no trace, no sound--evaporated.  Tolyan just stares at the rope, scared shitless, 'til I drag him away.  Even when we've cleared the tunnel, he doesn't say a word.  And hasn't to this day.

2033\voices\l08_market\history_9=Once I picked up a transmission from a surviving tank crew.  They were off-base on maneuvers when it all happened. They barrelled through the burning villages, picked some women up along the way – and just kept going, refueling when they could.   Finally, in the middle of nowhere, they ran out of gas.  Since there were no strategic targets that far out, the radiation wasn't nearly as high as in the cities. So they dug their tank in like a pillbox, and put up some tents.  They had a solar generator, and plenty of ammo, and settled around that tank for good.  I spoke with them by radio every night for almost two years.  At first they did okay...planted crops, two of them had almost normal kids.  They saw lots of weird critters out there, that their lieutenant didn't know how to describe. 2033\voices\l22_black\invisible_wachers_d1_0=二番地下鉄と見えない監視人の話を聞いた事は？
2033\voices\l22_black\invisible_wachers_d1_1=いや。
2033\voices\l22_black\invisible_wachers_d1_2=“神々の最後の戦い”、ラグナロクの事は？ 二番地下鉄ってのは、 悪の軍勢が蔓延ったら、ソビエト神殿の神々が避難所として使う場所なんだ。 “二番地下鉄”はこの真下に隠されてるって伝説だ。 俺達の地下鉄は羊のため、 二番地下鉄は羊飼いと牧羊犬のため。 昔、羊飼いはそこから群れを支配していた。 だがその後、 奴らの力が弱くなって、羊はあちこちに居なくなった。 ある一つのゲートが二つの世界を繋いでいた、 赤い傷跡で地図でわかれた場所でな。 だが何かが起き、第二地下鉄へのゲートは永遠に閉じられた。 生きてる奴らは第二地下鉄の事は忘れて、それは神話になった。 でも俺達が第二地下鉄を知らないだけで、それは存在する。 それは俺達を取り囲み、 俺達と絡み合って、 その駅は俺達の駅の壁の裏にある。 二つの地下鉄は切り離せないんだ。 それで羊飼いが群れを見捨てていなくて、まだ俺達を見ている、俺達の道を支持している、 でも決して自分達の姿は見せないって信じてる奴らが居る。 それが“見えない監視人”で信じられてることだ。
2033\voices\l22_black\invisible_wachers_d1_3=でも何で奴らは自分のことを知ってほしくないんだ？
2033\voices\l22_black\invisible_wachers_d1_4=まず第一に、 羊は罪深い、 羊飼いが弱くなったとき断ったために。 それに、第二地下鉄が俺達の世界から切り離されて以来、 羊飼いは別の方向に進化したんだ。 彼らはもはや人間じゃない、だが高い階級の生物、その考えは俺達には理解できないんだ。 彼らは何もかも変える力を持っていて、 俺達に美しい世界を取り戻させることだってできる。 でも俺達が彼らに反抗したから、 彼らはもう俺達の運命に手を出さない。 どうあれ、 彼らはどこにでもいて、何でも知っていて、全てを見ている。 俺達が罪を悔いた後にだけ、 姿を現して救いを差し伸べる。 そして救済は訪れる。 これが見えない監視人を信じてる奴に言われたことだ。

With arrogant Polis bastards eating our food! Many times have the Warriors of Reich proven their superiority over this scum! But these leeches still have the audacity to question our "humanity", and even demand that we observe the so called "rights" of any and all who inhabit the Metro. But, I say: We are the ones who will define "humanity" – and it does not include mutants!
voices\l01_jail\jai_fuhrer_speech_2=This is a sacred mission – to protect and preserve our race. Only Reich is strong enough, courageous enough, pure enough to drive back the mutants and twisted vermin that storm the gates! We alone are systematically and implacably wiping out the abhumans, those infected with corruption and spread it by multiplying their filth! Only Reich is eradicating the mutants that stalk our women! We are the true guardians of humanity and its gene pool, against the unending hordes of freaks! Hail Reich!
voices\l01_jail\jai_fuhrer_speech_3=For twenty years, we have lead this crusade. And in the other stations, ungrateful, cowardly rats forge conspiracies against us, fearing our predestined victory! Yes, Reich is short of soldiers, weapons, food, medicine – but we're well used to hardships! We have never surrendered, never retreated – and never will! "Human rights", they cry! But they have forgotten – it is humans, and only humans who are entitled to any rights whatsoever! And by humans, we mean the children of the super-race, the citizens of Reich! Hail Reich!
voices\l01_jail\jai_fuhrer_speech_4=We must question the motives, the loyalties of any who would grant such liberties, when there has never been a greater need to restrict them! There can only be two conclusions: Those calling for open rights are in league with the mutants – or are themselves mutants! They are happy to sell the future of Humanity to the freaks, for some lowly transient profit, and to populate the Earth with abominations! How should the citizens of Reich respond? With the fire of our weapons and the strength of our bonds! This is our destiny! Hail Reich!
voices\l01_jail\jai_fuhrer_speech_5=The foretold apocalypse eradicated the weak, the deformed, the unfit – but it left the world in the hands of a single entity, a monolith, a community of truly like-minded citizens, cemented with the doctrine of racial purity! This is the final stage in the development of human society! We march towards a brave new world, forged of shining steel, tempered in a nuclear crucible! And there's no place for chimeras in this shining future! I am not talking about those worrisome mutants we'll drive to extinction. No, I have other chimeras in mind – those capable of tarnishing our resolve with their poisonous breath: the chimeras of "conscience", and "compassion" and "lenience"! The chimeras of "equality" and "virtue"!
voices\l01_jail\jai_fuhrer_speech_6=These are meaningless words, empty doctrines to confuse the weak of mind – the very concepts that took humanity to the brink of utter destruction. It is time for us to close our ranks even tighter, to build our walls even higher! It is time to put the chimeras to the sword of truth! We shall carry this sword throughout the Metro – and all who stand against us will be cut down like dry wheat! Hail Reich!
voices\l01_jail\jai_fuhrer_speech_7=Citizens of Reich! Valiant warriors of our invincible legions! I trust in your resolve, your will, your dedication!
